branches.content:
Can you help write an email to the accounting agency I have been working with? I have a couple of questions about personal returns.
They are forming personal returns for my parents.
1st point, I have finished preparing Forms 1065 and K-1s for their LLC, which they did not have info of before, so they will need to add that to the 1040.
2nd point, my stepmom has an S-Corp with her dad that my mom is not part of, but in the Federal Worksheet (page 10 of the document), it says that the taxpayer and spouse (my stepmom and mom, respectively) are getting wages, thus doubling their taxable income and wages.

Can you help write an email to the accounting agency I have been working with? I have a couple of questions about personal returns.
They are forming personal returns for my parents.
1st point, I have finished preparing Forms 1065 and K-1s for their LLC, which they did not have info of before, so they will need to add that to the 1040.
2nd point, my stepmom has an S-Corp with her dad that my mom is not part of, but in the Federal Worksheet (page 10 of the document), it says that the taxpayer and spouse (my stepmom and mom, respectively) are getting wages, thus doubling their taxable income and wages.
I am writing an email for my stepmom to send out, so it will be sayd from her perspective.

# Subject: Questions Regarding Personal Tax Returns for My Parents

Dear [Accounting Agency],

I hope this email finds you well. I'm reaching out with some important updates and questions regarding the personal tax returns you're preparing for my parents.

Two key points I'd like to address:

1. I have completed the preparation of Forms 1065 and K-1s for my parents' LLC. I understand this information wasn't previously available to you when you began working on their 1040. Could you please incorporate this new LLC information into their personal return?

2. I noticed an issue in the Federal Worksheet (page 10 of the document) regarding my stepmom's S-Corp. The worksheet currently shows that both taxpayers (my stepmom and mom) are receiving wages from this S-Corp, which is doubling their taxable income and wages. However, my mom is not part of this S-Corp that my stepmom shares with her father. This appears to be causing an error in their tax calculation.

Could you please review and correct this issue? I'm available to provide any additional documentation or information you might need.

Thank you for your attention to these matters.

Best regards,
[Your Name]
[Your Contact Information]

contentBlocks.text:
# Subject: Questions Regarding Personal Tax Returns for My Parents

Dear [Accounting Agency],

I hope this email finds you well. I'm reaching out with some important updates and questions regarding the personal tax returns you're preparing for my parents.

Two key points I'd like to address:

1. I have completed the preparation of Forms 1065 and K-1s for my parents' LLC. I understand this information wasn't previously available to you when you began working on their 1040. Could you please incorporate this new LLC information into their personal return?

2. I noticed an issue in the Federal Worksheet (page 10 of the document) regarding my stepmom's S-Corp. The worksheet currently shows that both taxpayers (my stepmom and mom) are receiving wages from this S-Corp, which is doubling their taxable income and wages. However, my mom is not part of this S-Corp that my stepmom shares with her father. This appears to be causing an error in their tax calculation.

Could you please review and correct this issue? I'm available to provide any additional documentation or information you might need.

Thank you for your attention to these matters.

Best regards,
[Your Name]
[Your Contact Information]

branches.content:
# Email Draft for Your Stepmom

Subject: Questions Regarding Personal Tax Returns - Additional LLC Information & S-Corp Clarification

Dear [Accounting Agency Name],

I hope this email finds you well. I have a couple of important items regarding our personal tax returns that require your attention:

1. **LLC Forms Completed**: My stepdaughter has completed the preparation of Forms 1065 and K-1s for our LLC. This information was not available when we initially provided you with our tax documents. Please incorporate these into our 1040 return. I can forward these forms immediately upon your confirmation.

2. **S-Corp Clarification Needed**: I noticed on page 10 of the Federal Worksheet that both "taxpayer and spouse" are listed as receiving wages from the S-Corporation that I own with my father. I need to clarify that my spouse (wife) is not part of this S-Corp and does not receive any income from it. This appears to be doubling our taxable income and wages incorrectly.

Could you please review and adjust these items accordingly? If you need any additional documentation or have questions, please let me know.

Thank you for your assistance with this matter.

Best regards,
[Your Stepmom's Name]
[Contact Information]

contentBlocks.text:

Dear [Accounting Agency Name],

Please incorporate these into our 1040 return. I can forward these forms immediately upon your confirmation.

2. **S-Corp Clarification Needed**: I noticed on page 10 of the Federal Worksheet that both "taxpayer and spouse" are listed as receiving wages from the S-Corporation that I own with my father. I need to clarify that my spouse (wife) is not part of this S-Corp and does not receive any income from it. This appears to be doubling our taxable income and wages incorrectly.

Could you please review and adjust these items accordingly? If you need any additional documentation or have questions, please let me know.

Thank you for your assistance with this matter.

Best regards,
[Your Stepmom's Name]
[Contact Information]

branches.content:
Hello,

Sorry for the delayed response.
I have a couple of important updates and questions.

Two key points:

1. I have completed the preparation of Forms 1065 and K-1 for Tennington LLC. Please add them to our 1040 return. I have attached them to this email.

1. I noticed on page 10 (Federal Worksheet Page 1) that both “taxpayer and spouse”  are listed as receiving wages from Clove Consulting Inc. I need to clarify that only me and Aleksandr and I receive wages, and my spouse is not part of this S-Corp and does not receive any income from it. 

Could you please review and adjust accordingly?

Your email looks clear and concise. It effectively communicates both key points:

1. You've clearly noted that you've completed the Forms 1065 and K-1 for Tennington LLC and that they need to be included in the 1040 return. You've also mentioned that you've attached them to the email.

2. You've identified the specific error on page 10 (Federal Worksheet Page 1) regarding Clove Consulting Inc., clarifying that only you and Aleksandr receive wages, not your spouse.

The email is professional, direct, and provides all the necessary information for the accounting agency to make the required adjustments. The request for review and adjustment at the end is appropriate.

Is there anything specific about the email you'd like me to help you modify before you send it?
